block.p: Bridget Walsh Guiney, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis M. Guiney of Radnor, Pa., was married on Friday to John Peter Devine, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Michael F. Devine Jr. of Gladwyne, Pa. Anthony Cardinal Bevilacqua, the Archbishop of Philadelphia, performed the ceremony at St. John Vianney Roman Catholic Church in Gladwyne. Msgr. Richard Malone, an uncle of the bridegroom, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Devine graduated summa cum laude from Fairfield University. She is an executive account manager in the Philadelphia office of AT&T Global Information Solutions, a computer manufacturing division of the communications company. Her father retired as the sales manager for the Synthane Taylor Corporation, a former plastics manufacturer in Valley Forge, Pa. Her mother, Patrice, retired as a substitute teacher in the elementary schools of Tredyffrin Township, Pa.

Bridget Walsh Guiney, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis M. Guiney of Radnor, Pa., was married on Friday to John Peter Devine, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Michael F. Devine Jr. of Gladwyne, Pa. Anthony Cardinal Bevilacqua, the Archbishop of Philadelphia, performed the ceremony at St. John Vianney Roman Catholic Church in Gladwyne. Msgr. Richard Malone, an uncle of the bridegroom, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Devine graduated summa cum laude from Fairfield University. She is an executive account manager in the Philadelphia office of AT&T Global Information Solutions, a computer manufacturing division of the communications company. Her father retired as the sales manager for the Synthane Taylor Corporation, a former plastics manufacturer in Valley Forge, Pa. Her mother, Patrice, retired as a substitute teacher in the elementary schools of Tredyffrin Township, Pa.
The bride's maternal grandfather, the late Anthony J. McAllister Sr., was the president and chairman of McAllister Brothers, a towing and marine transportation company in New York.

Mr. Devine, who is known as Jay, graduated from Georgetown University. He is a vice president in Philadelphia with FCB/Tierney, an advertising and public relations firm. His father is an internist at Lankenau Hospital in Wynnewood, Pa.
